questions.question: The <u>separation of powers</u> refers to the division of government into:
questions.explanation: Separation of powers divides government into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

questions.question: The <u>separation of powers</u> refers to the division of government into:
questions.explanation: Separation of powers divides government into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

questions.question: The <u>constitution</u> of a country is:

options.text: The supreme law of the land

questions.explanation: A constitution is the fundamental law that establishes the structure and functions of government.

questions.question: In a <u>democracy</u>, the ultimate source of power is the:
questions.explanation: In a democracy, power is derived from the people who elect their representatives.

questions.question: In a <u>federal system</u> of government, power is:

options.text: Divided between central and regional governments

questions.explanation: Federalism divides power between a central government and regional (state/local) governments.

questions.question: The <u>separation of powers</u> refers to the division of government into:
questions.explanation: Separation of powers divides government into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

questions.explanation: Separation of powers divides government into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

questions.question: <u>Universal adult suffrage</u> means:
questions.explanation: Universal adult suffrage means all adult citizens have the right to vote regardless of status.

options.text: Divided between central and regional governments
